channel.title: Reporting Posts
channel.description:
Hi.
I was just wondering, when should you really report posts to a moderator with being a brown-nosing, wannabe-mod snitch?
Obviously, posts that are a blatant attempt at spreading something malicious should be reported straight away. Every other legit report, in my opinion, helps clean up the spammers etc., so the people know what's and what's not acceptable.
I believe it's quite important to report even the minor things, to help build the "atmosphere", so to speak, of the community. This then makes the whole experience that little bit better for [i]everyone[/i].
I realise too, that maybe some administrators don't really care for the little things, so long as there is a relatively respectful forum at present.
Although there are rules, there's always going to be grey areas, so here's the chance to discuss it.
What do you think?

item.title: Reporting Posts
item.dc:creator: @the_soul The Soul
item.description:
@the_soul wrote:

[quote=“мonster, post:8, topic:404991”][quote author=The Soul link=topic=502007.msg3672703#msg3672703 date=1311039822]

Do MoparScape’s staff care about the petty things? These are the grey areas I’m talking about.

Moderating is solely based on the moderator’s discretion. While one moderator may think so, another may not. However, the reporting end is also based on discretion and you need to make a judgement call and think if there’s really a problem or you’re just looking for something to report.
[/quote]
Precisely. So what if something was reported that you deemed petty and annoying that someone would report that, but the reporter deemed it unnecessary for whatever reason? You would think they are looking for something to report whereas the reporter had a genuine reason.

This is where things get twisted and people start to make judgements, resulting in false projections of people.

Like for instance, all this “what the fuck is there to think about” may seem stupid to you, but I truly think at least an effort of a discussion would be good/useful to some people reading this.

Another example, I wouldn’t want to be portrayed as something negative for posting a topic like this, as I think people getting the true image of who you really are is important.[/quote]

Not unless it’s a repeated ‘offense’, if you will. Otherwise I’ll just close it and think nothing more.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @_onster мonster
item.description:
@_onster wrote:

I don’t think anyone else sees it like I do… anyhow, anybody who causes trouble in a topic should be reported and action taken against the individual, the topic should not be spoilt by the incompetence of others.

My main aim was to see who the hypocrites are, as one minute people can post the usual banter, that is still regarded as spam, and then the next be telling people that they posted a stupid topic, or in the wrong section.

When someone is harmlessly having a laugh with another forum-er, and in effect still spamming, should they still be reported for derailing/trolling/having a laugh.

Do MoparScape’s staff care about the petty things? These are the grey areas I’m talking about.

I don’t mind a debate, so long as it doesn’t become an argument (getting personal, which most people find it hard to distinguish).
